PARAGRAPH.STRING: , officially the Eastern Republic of Uruguay or the Republic East of the Uruguay (River) ([Spanish: República Oriental del Uruguay]; pron. IPA [IPA: [re'puβ̞lika oɾjen'tal del uɾu'ɰwaj]]), is a nation located in southern part of South America.

is bordered by Brazil to the north, the Uruguay River to the west, the estuary of the Río de la Plata (literally "River of Silver", but commonly known in English as "River Plate") to the southwest, with Argentina on the other bank of both, and finally the South Atlantic Ocean to the southeast. About half of
people live in the capital and largest city, Montevideo.
is the second smallest independent country in South America, larger only than Suriname (
is also larger than French Guiana, which is not independent), and
is the most politically and economically stable.
was once dominated by Brazil and Portugal. On August 25, 1825, José Gervasio Artigas, led the fight for independence and that is now the national holiday.
